Package gov.tak.api.contact

Interface IContactService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContactStore
    public interface IContactService
    Contract for service that maintains an application-wide collection of Contacts. The Contact service allows core applications and plugins to manage IContacts through the API, as well as register/unregister IContactListeners so that listeners can receive notifications when Contacts are added, removed, or updated.

    Aside from takkernel-implemented components, it is typically expected that plugins will be responsible for managing Contacts as sourced through a specific transport protocol (e.g. XMPP).

    On the other hand, it is typically expected that core applications will register as Contact Listeners to be notified of changes in Contacts, thereby informing the user of all available Contacts at any given time.

    An instance of this class can be accessed through the Contacts class, and immutable IContact instances can be built through the available ContactBuilder classes. For example: 

         IContactService contactStore = Contacts.getDefaultContactStore();
     IIndividualContact contact = new IndividualContactBuilder().withUniqueId("uniqueNewYork").build();
     contactStore.registerContactListener(contactListener);
     contactStore.addContact(contact);
     contactStore.unregisterContactListener(contactListener);
    See Also:
    IContact, IContactListener

    • Method Detail

      • addContact

        void addContact​(@NonNull
                IContact contact)
        Adds a contact to be stored and maintained by the API. Note that attempting to add a contact that has already been added will cause no effect; no listeners will be notified of the attempt.

        This method should not be called from an IContactListener or any form of UI layer that is not directly responsible for managing and communicating with contacts through a chat service of some kind (which should never be the case).

        Parameters:
        contact - The contact to add

      • updateContact

        void updateContact​(@NonNull
                   IContact contact)
        Updates a contact that is currently being stored by the API. I.e., replaces the contact that has a unique ID matching that of the given contact, as decided by IContact.getUid(). Note that the contact must have already been added via addContact(IContact).

        This method should not be called from an IContactListener or any form of UI layer that is not directly responsible for managing and communicating with contacts through a chat service of some kind (which should never be the case).

        Parameters:
        contact - The updated contact
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is no existing contact to update

      • removeContact

        void removeContact​(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String uniqueContactId)
        Removes a contact so that it is no longer stored by the API. If the contact does not exist, then listeners will not be notified of the removal attempt.

        This method should not be called from an IContactListener or any form of UI layer that is not directly responsible for managing and communicating with contacts through a chat service of some kind (which should never be the case).

        Parameters:
        uniqueContactId - The unique ID of the contact to remove

      • getContact

        @Nullable
IContact getContact​(@NonNull
                    java.lang.String contactUid)
        Gets a contact that has a UID matching the given UID string (as decided by String.equals(Object)).
        Parameters:
        contactUid - The UID of the contact to get
        Returns:
        The contact with the given UID, or null if no such contact exists in the store

      • getAllContacts

        java.util.List<IContact> getAllContacts()
        Returns all the contacts currently in the store.
        Returns:
        A list containing all the contacts currently in the store.

      • getAllContactsOfType

        @NonNull
default <T extends IContact> java.util.List<T> getAllContactsOfType​(@NonNull
                                                                    java.lang.Class<T> contactType)
        Obtain a collection of all contacts of the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Inferred type
        Parameters:
        contactType - Type of contact to return, must be a subtype of IContact
        Returns:
        Collection of contacts of the given type, may be empty, never null

      • registerContactListener

        void registerContactListener​(@NonNull
                             IContactListener contactListener)
        Registers a contact listener to be notified of changes to all existing contacts. The same listener instance cannot be registered more than once (without first unregistering via unregisterContactListener(IContactListener)).
        Parameters:
        contactListener - The listener to register

      • unregisterContactListener

        void unregisterContactListener​(@NonNull
                               IContactListener contactListener)
        Unregisters a contact listener so that it no longer receives notifications about contacts.
        Parameters:
        contactListener - The listener to unregister
